data.text: @ParadigmFallen I do not know.
@WritNelson How did we never get a movie of Alan Rickman and Tim Curry competitively chewing the scenery?
@WritNelson @WordMercenary @richardcobbett Watching him be the silly trick gunslinger in Silverado is bizarre
@WritNelson @withoutaplain https://t.co/plCWkrH5rB
@crwilso @WritNelson Mornin’
@V_Ben @WritNelson BEN
@withoutaplain Who's Ruby Wax?
@withoutaplain @WordMercenary @richardcobbett Yeah, I really dig Costner in supporting positions. He isn't a *bad* actor. Just kinda a...plain one.

@V_Ben hahaha--

ohhhhhhhh https://t.co/J609yPpzAi
@withoutaplain @richardcobbett @WritNelson JFK is probably his best performance. Something about his boringness colliding with Stone's overexcitability and cancelling one another out.

@WritNelson “It makes an otherwise tedious first two hours bearable--and the climax IS fantastic.”

Ah, my tinder profile
@richardcobbett @WordMercenary @WritNelson On the plus side: https://t.co/yuuLqmtHWb

@richardcobbett @WordMercenary @WritNelson This. And Waterworld was a fun idea, whereas the Postman was excruciating. USA-style patriotism after an apocalypse? About the fucking postal service? Christ.

@WordMercenary @richardcobbett @WritNelson I kinda like Waterworld. And Costner's fatal mistake was always being the lead, he was so dull at that. Put him in a support role and he was sometimes surprisingly good.

@WritNelson I loved that film as a kid. Proper loved it. Watched it again a couple of years ago with a view to livetweeting and it was so DULL I could barely think of anything to say.

Apparently Rickman only agreed to do it if he could rewrite/ad lib, which he did over lunch with Ruby Wax
@WordMercenary @WritNelson Waterworld is a complete mess, but it's at least an INTERESTING mess. The Postman is just a snorer.
@richardcobbett @WritNelson oh yeah, the Postman is a much worse movie. The incredibly expensive set design in Waterworld is actually pretty good!
@WordMercenary @WritNelson In semi-fairness, Waterworld is mostly infamous because of how much it cost. It's not a notably worse movie than most other 'meh' stuff at the time.
@WritNelson and they all came out in just a few years! It was weird. Anyway then Waterworld was a huge flop and that was that.
@WordMercenary Looking at them in a row, they're so SIMILAR in type/story/character, too.
@WritNelson I think Dances With Wolves kicked it off but he had a run of big expensive self produced stinkers (Prince of Thieves, Postman, Waterworld)
@WordMercenary @WritNelson Also led to Men In Tights, aka The Last Watchable Mel Brooks film, helped immeasurably by how pompous King Of Thieves was.

@WordMercenary From what I remember, Dances with Wolves was fine? Haven't seen Field of Dreams.

He had an unusual number of epics like this under his belt, compared to other more modern actors?
@WritNelson ah the era of the Kevin Costner vanity project. I am still uncertain how or why that happened. This is by far the most watchable.
@WritNelson @IndieGamerChick Struckley has loxed again!
@WritNelson Ah yes - the version of England where you can ride from Dover to Nottingham in an afternoon and still have time to pop to Hadrian's wall. English is small, but not THAT small.
@WritNelson It's too back that Alan Rickman had to do so much overacting to make up for Costner's underacting. Still an enjoyable popcorn flick.
TFW you realize you have to wade through another forty-five minutes to get another Sheriff of Nottingham scene: https://t.co/7OCJyrEs7y
